nitf
Class NITFResourceManager

java.lang.Object
  nitf.NITFResourceManager

public final class NITFResourceManager
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides the functionality to manage the underlying memory

manageDestructibleObject

protected void manageDestructibleObject(DestructibleObject object,
                                        boolean manageIt)
Request the Manager to manage (or not manage) the given object. If manageIt is true, the management count is incremented. Otherwise, it is decremented.

Parameters:
object -
manageIt -

freeAllMemory

protected void freeAllMemory()
This function will free ALL of the underlying native memory, thus making all of existing Java objects usesless.

Call this method when you are ready to exit the system, or when you are surely never going to use any of the existing Java objects or their functionalities anymore.

This function will get called automatically when the application using it shuts down, so you don't have to add it to your programs.

trackIOHandle

protected void trackIOHandle(IOInterface handle)
Tells the framework to keep track of the given IOHandle. This handle will be freed with a call to closeAllIOHandles()

Parameters:
handle -

closeAllIOHandles

protected void closeAllIOHandles()
This function will close any IOHandle that was created. This function can be called any time, so users must be careful not to use any closed handles.

This function gets called by freeAllMemory()

loadPluginDir

public static void loadPluginDir(java.lang.String dirName)
                          throws NITFException
This attempts to load plugins from the directory given

Parameters:
dirName - plugin directory to load
Throws:
NITFException
